The government has also established a number of policies and strategies to support the development of renewable energy that are designed to be sustainable in the long term, such as the Climate Change Plan and the Energy Strategy.

In addition, there is increasing recognition of the importance of integrating renewable energy into the broader energy system, rather than just developing individual projects. The Scottish Government's Smart Grid Strategy, for example, seeks to develop a more integrated and responsive electricity system that is better able to accommodate large-scale renewable energy generation.

Finally, there is recognition of the importance of developing sustainable economic models for renewable energy that can support long-term investments and ensure that benefits are shared fairly across communities. This includes efforts to develop community-owned renewable energy projects and to ensure that local supply chains are created around renewable energy projects to create and sustain local jobs.

In summary, Ayrshire and wider Scotland have an ambitious vision and comprehensive long term plans to make renewable energy sector sustainable, economically and environmentally.
